channel.title: Remote audio streaming
channel.description: Recently I have been using team-viewer a lot to access my PC away from home. This works great, but there is no support for streaming audio from the remote computer. Is there any free software out there that can accomplish this task?

item.title: Remote audio streaming
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

so if i understand you want more than just you to hear. sorry i didnt understand what you were wanting to do at first.

(disclaimer right now i have windows xp and dont now if this method works with later versions of windows without some modifications)
you could host a mumble server, then load a mumble client on the computer you want to stream from.
goto config > settings from the menu bar. (if you havent used mumble b4 then find a video on youtube; after you install just skip the audio setup, and just add a new server with ip address of the mumble server and connect.)
change transmission > transmit from voice activity or w/e it was to continuous.
apply and click ok.

now head over to advanced volume controls.(master volume, cant navigate to by right clicking the speaker icon in the system tray and clicking open volume controls from the context menu)
goto options > properties in the menu bar.
change mixer device from output to input and check the box next to stereo mix and click ok.
adjust the volume on stereo mix and i think you are ready to stream audio.

note: you can adjust the quality and packets stuff in mumble settings. if you cant do the stereo mix method on later versions of windows you should be able to find a 3rd party input mixer. I’m sorry I dont know of a solution for vista and 7. also I havent tried this out but it should work in theory.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote audio streaming
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

it’s going to sound like shit if you use VOIP/etc

Read full topic

item.title: Remote audio streaming
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

xryz:

so https://play.google.com/music/listen isnt an option? its extremely easy to use. you can store 20k of your own uploaded songs + every song you purchase from them(even more if you make another account). you dont need to have your computer on just to stream your music to another. if you have an Internet enabled mobile device you may be able to use it from that device. Its just a suggestion b/c i use it.

My goal is not to listen to music, but rather to stream audio directly from a host computer. This site is pretty cool, though thanks for showing me it.

I’ve been using teamviewer as a remote control program, which allows VOIP but I’m not sure if it’s possible to configure that to stream the computer’s audio (the stuff that comes out of the speakers)

Read full topic

you can remotely change the playlists
[/quote]
this is nice to know, however what I am looking for is remote real-time audio[/quote]
… it’s remote, the stream is being encoded in real time, and you can pick what tracks you wish to listen to?
